content.body: Anybody got a site that sends `Accept-Ranges: none`? Need one for an example in MDN https://github.com/mdn/content/issues/16073

content.body: Anyone know where the parsing of "video", "audio" and "picture" are handled in the HTML spec?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Anyone know where the parsing of "video", "audio" and "picture" are handled in the HTML spec?

content.body: If you search for "video", "audio" and "picture" in multipage/parsing.html you get nothing, so I'm assuming under "any other start tag" in body
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: If you search for "video", "audio" and "picture" in multipage/parsing.html you get nothing, so I'm assuming under "any other start tag" in body

content.body: Interesting. I assumed that every valid element would be explicitly mentioned, but I guess not.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Interesting. I assumed that every valid element would be explicitly mentioned, but I guess not.

content.body:
Most "inline" elements don't need special rules; others often need to imply `

` and such which is why they get mentioned by name
content.formatted_body: Most "inline" elements don't need special rules; others often need to imply </p> and such which is why they get mentioned by name

` and such which is why they get mentioned by name

content.body:
> <@sideshowbarker:mozilla.org> Anybody got a site that sends `Accept-Ranges: none`? Need one for an example in MDN https://github.com/mdn/content/issues/16073

https://www.paypal.com/xoplatform/logger/api/logger

(From BigQuery: SELECT url FROM `httparchive.summary_requests.2022_04_01_mobile` WHERE resp_accept_ranges="none" LIMIT 1000, can probably play with it yourself for better results)
